definitions.definition: To watch or tend someone else's child for a period of time, often for money .
examples: My daughter is babysitting for the Morgans at number ten, who are going out on a date night.
We need someone to babysit our children while we go to the theater.

definitions.definition: To watch or tend a thing or process without normally intervening in it, e.g. as a precaution should an emergency happen.
examples: The reaction takes several hours, so we leave a graduate student to babysit it.

definitions.definition: To watch or attend anything or anyone more closely than ought to be needed; to have to help or coax too much.
examples: He left me to babysit the new guy while he got some work done.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To watch or tend someone else's child for a period of time, often for money .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , informal ) To watch or tend a thing or process without normally intervening in it, e.g. as a precaution should an emergency happen.
( transitive , informal ) To watch or attend anything or anyone more closely than ought to be needed; to have to help or coax too much.
